Class DataSet

java.lang.Object
DataHolders.DataSet
Direct Known Subclasses:
ObservationSet
public class DataSet extends Object

    Creates a DataSet to contain str unit types of DataPoints

    Creates a DataSet matching the parameter ArrayList of DataPoint objects

  • Constructor Details

    • DataSet

      public DataSet(String str)
      Creates a DataSet to contain str unit types of DataPoints
      Parameters:
      str - The units of the DataSet

    • DataSet

      public DataSet(String str, ArrayList<DataPoint> d)
      Creates a DataSet matching the parameter ArrayList of DataPoint objects
      Parameters:
      str - Unit type of the DataSet
      d - Input ArrayList for the DataSet
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Throws an IllegalArgumentException if d is empty or if the units of the DataPoints in d and str don't match

  • Method Details

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns the DataSet as an array string
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      Returns a formatted String containing each DataPoint in the DataSet

    • sortAscendingMeasurements

      public void sortAscendingMeasurements()
      Sorts the DataSet in ascending order

      public DataPoint getMedian()
      Returns the median value of the DataSet
      Returns:
      Returns a DataPoint representing the median value of the DataSet

      public DataPoint getMean()
      Returns the mean value of the DataSet
      Returns:
      Returns a DataPoint representing the mean value of the DataSet

    • getMode

      public DataPoint getMode()
      Returns the mode value of the DataSet
      Returns:
      Returns a DataPoint representing the mode value of the DataSet

    • isSortedAscending

      public boolean isSortedAscending()
      Returns a boolean representing whether the DataSet has been sorted in ascending order
      Returns:
      Returns true if the DataSet has been sorted in ascending order of measurements, false if not

    • roundAll

      public void roundAll(int p)
      Rounds all the DataPoints in the DataSet to the given number of decimal places
      Parameters:
      p - The number of decimal places to round each DataPoint's measurement to

    • addDataPoint

      public void addDataPoint(DataPoint d, boolean b)
      Adds a DataPoint to the end of the DataSet, then sorts DataSet in ascending order based on b
      Parameters:
      d - The DataPoint to add to the DataSet
      b - Sorts the DataSet in ascending order if true, does nothing if false
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - Throws an IllegalArgumentException if unit types do not match between the DataSet and given DataPoint,

    • removeFirstInstance

      public DataPoint removeFirstInstance(double d)
      Removes the first instance of a DataPoint containing a measurement matching d and returns it
      Parameters:
      d - The measurement that will be searched for
      Returns:
      Returns the removed DataPoint if it is found, returns null if the DataPoint is not found

    • getUnits

      public String getUnits()
      Returns units
      Returns:
      Returns the unit type of the DataSet

    • getDataList

      public ArrayList<DataPoint> getDataList()
      Returns dataList
      Returns:
      Returns the DataSet's ArrayList of DataPoints
